website_summaries.verdict: A great climbing glove for when you're on the wall. A good, reusable way to replace the need for tape.
pros: Built to help protect your hands without sacrificing a feel for the wall – open palm and fingers and ultralight material
Great for protecting your hands during crack climbing
cons: Fabric can tear after extended use

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought in November, but used only few times in a gym over the last few weeks. Wanted to check as an alternative to Ocun, especially with extended cover over wrists. Well.. the picture is pretty clear -- the protective layer on my knuckles just came off, though in other places the gloves are like new. Wish I could return them.
customer_reviews.author: Kirill

customer_reviews.title: Stop buying tape!
customer_reviews.text: This is sooo much better than constantly buying tape. Even though it is a little loose, I prefer this to bringing tape and wasting time before climbing with tape. While I would not tape for areas like yosemite or tahoe that has smooth granite, I find myself taking them out of the bag and using them without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: reader7

customer_reviews.title: New to Crack
customer_reviews.text: New to crack climbing. I used this at an indoor gym and it's held up so far to 10+ climbs so far. I also ended using this outdoors at JTree for the first time doing crack climbing outdoors and it also worked well. Good protection and friction.
customer_reviews.author: Scray

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but lack durability
customer_reviews.text: These are my go-to gloves for thinner cracks. My Ocun gloves are only for wide cracks. However, these gloves started to tear after 1 month of intense use. I’ve since taped up the back of the gloves to extend their lifespan. If you’re a serious crack climber you’ll probably have to replace these every few months...
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Finger hole material a little thinner than I like but that may be designed for function and not for cost of material. Holds up better than expected though.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest S.

customer_reviews.title: Best crack glove out there
customer_reviews.text: Thin and effective. My second pair, they wear amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Really nice! Not too thick and quick to take on ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice! Not too thick and quick to take on and off. Great if you're doing a bit of crack climbing and a bit of other stuff in the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Klein

customer_reviews.title: They work great! More convenient than tape and effective on even ...
customer_reviews.text: They work great! More convenient than tape and effective on even sharp granite crystals in central AZ!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: durable yet super thin
customer_reviews.text: Protects the back of your hands without restricting movement. Does not tear even under repeated strain. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Michael Engle

customer_reviews.title: Got two days out of them
customer_reviews.text: Got a day cragging at Cat Wall and one rim route out of them... meh... Back to tape...
customer_reviews.author: trell

product_meta.title: Outdoor Research Splitter Gloves
feature_bullets: Fabric Performance: Durable, Ultra-Tactile, Ultra Lightweight
